definitions: person who habitually acts in a cruel or unpleasant manner toward others
examples: Don't be such a meany to your little sister
The playground meany kept taking everyone's lunch money

definitions: highly infectious viral disease causing fever and distinctive red spotted rash on the skin
examples: The child stayed home from school with measles
Measles vaccination has greatly reduced childhood illness rates

definitions: process of finding the size, amount, or degree of something using instruments or standard units
examples: Accurate measuring is essential for baking success
The contractor spent the morning measuring the room dimensions

definitions: business of slaughtering animals and preparing their meat for sale and distribution
examples: The meatpacking plant employed hundreds of local workers
Chicago was once the center of American meatpacking operations

definitions: place that attracts many people with particular interests or activities
holy city in Saudi Arabia that is the spiritual center of Islam
examples: Silicon Valley is a mecca for tech entrepreneurs
Las Vegas has become a mecca for entertainment seekers
Millions of Muslims make pilgrimages to Mecca each year
The direction of Mecca determines prayer orientation for Muslims

definitions: introduction of machines or automatic devices to replace human labor in manufacturing or other processes
examples: The mechanisation of farming transformed agricultural productivity
Factory mechanisation led to massive changes in employment patterns

definitions: introduction of machines or automatic devices to replace human labor in manufacturing or other processes
examples: Agricultural mechanization revolutionized food production worldwide
The mechanization of textile manufacturing sparked the Industrial Revolution

definitions: athlete or competitor who has been awarded a medal for achievement in sports or competition
examples: The Olympic gold medalist signed autographs for fans
She became a three-time medalist at the world championships

definitions: large medal or circular ornamental design used as decoration or worn as jewelry
examples: The antique medallion featured intricate engravings of historical scenes
She wore a gold medallion on a chain around her neck

definitions: athlete or competitor who has been awarded a medal for achievement in sports or competition
examples: The British gold medallist received a hero's welcome
Several medallists attended the sports awards ceremony last night

definitions: act of involving oneself in matters that are not one's concern or responsibility
examples: His constant meddling in office politics created unnecessary tension
The neighbors complained about her meddling in their family affairs

definitions: emergency transportation of sick or injured people by aircraft to medical facilities
examples: The injured hiker required immediate medevac from the mountain
Military medevac helicopters saved countless lives during the conflict

definitions: middle number in a sorted list of numbers or statistical data set
strip of land or barrier separating opposite lanes of traffic on a highway
examples: The median income for the neighborhood was fifty thousand dollars
Calculate the median of these test scores for analysis
The car crossed the median and collided with oncoming traffic
Trees were planted in the highway median for beautification

definitions: intervention in a dispute to help parties reach an agreement without going to court
examples: The couple chose mediation instead of a lengthy divorce trial
Labor mediation helped resolve the strike within two weeks

definitions: neutral person who helps opposing parties resolve conflicts and reach mutually acceptable agreements
examples: The mediator helped both sides find common ground
An experienced mediator was brought in to resolve the dispute

definitions: person trained to give emergency medical treatment, especially in military or emergency services
examples: The combat medic treated wounded soldiers on the battlefield
Paramedics and medics arrived quickly at the accident scene

definitions: informal term for a doctor or medical practitioner, especially in military contexts
examples: The old medico had been treating patients for forty years
Call the medico immediately about these symptoms

definitions: old walled part of a North African or Middle Eastern city
holy city in Saudi Arabia where Prophet Muhammad established the first Islamic community
examples: Tourists explored the narrow streets of Marrakech's ancient medina
The medina's traditional markets offered handcrafted goods and spices
Pilgrims visit Medina to pray at the Prophet's Mosque
Medina became the first capital of the Islamic state

definitions: quality of being only moderately good or ordinary rather than excellent or outstanding
examples: The restaurant's mediocrity was reflected in its bland menu
She refused to accept mediocrity in her academic performance

definitions: practice of focused thought or contemplation to achieve mental clarity and emotional calmness
examples: Daily meditation helped reduce her stress and anxiety levels
The monastery offered weekend retreats for meditation and reflection

definitions: collection or mixture of various items, especially musical pieces performed as one continuous piece
examples: The band performed a medley of their greatest hits
Dinner featured a colorful medley of roasted vegetables

definitions: free-swimming marine animal with a bell-shaped body and trailing tentacles
monster in Greek mythology with snakes for hair whose gaze turned people to stone
examples: The medusa floated gracefully through the aquarium tank
Scientists studied the medusa's unique swimming patterns
Perseus defeated Medusa by looking at her reflection in his shield
The ancient temple featured carvings of Medusa's frightening visage

definitions: small burrowing mammal with upright stance found in southern Africa, living in social groups
examples: The meerkat stood guard while others in the group foraged
Tourists watched meerkats pop up from their underground burrows

definitions: building used for public assemblies, especially religious worship or community meetings
examples: The Quaker meetinghouse had served the community for two centuries
Town decisions were debated at the historic meetinghouse

definitions: informal abbreviation for megabyte, a unit of computer memory or data storage
examples: The photo file was only two megs in size
This old computer has just sixty-four megs of RAM

definitions: unit of computer data storage equal to approximately one million bytes
examples: The document is three megabytes and too large to email
Modern smartphones have thousands of megabytes of storage capacity

definitions: unit of frequency equal to one million hertz, used especially for measuring computer processor speeds
examples: The old computer processor ran at just 100 megahertz
Radio stations broadcast at specific megahertz frequencies

definitions: cone-shaped device used to amplify and direct the voice for addressing crowds
examples: The protest leader used a megaphone to address the crowd
The coach shouted instructions through a megaphone during practice

definitions: unit of explosive force equivalent to one million tons of TNT
examples: The nuclear weapon had a yield of fifty megatons
Scientists measured the asteroid impact in megatons of force

definitions: unit of power equal to one million watts, used especially for measuring electricity generation
examples: The wind farm produces twenty megawatts of clean energy
The city's power plant has a capacity of 500 megawatts

definitions: durable plastic material used in laminates, adhesives, and dishware resistant to heat and chemicals
examples: The kitchen cabinets were covered with white melamine laminate
Melamine dishes are popular for outdoor dining because they don't break

definitions: severe form of depression characterized by profound sadness and loss of interest in life
examples: The poet's later works reflected his struggle with melancholia
Victorian doctors often diagnosed women with melancholia

definitions: person who experiences or is characterized by deep, persistent sadness or depression
examples: The melancholic spent hours staring out the window lost in thought
Artists and melancholics often find solace in creative expression

definitions: deep feeling of sadness or depression, typically with no obvious cause, often mixed with thoughtfulness
examples: Autumn weather always filled her with a sense of melancholy
The violin's melancholy notes perfectly matched the somber mood

definitions: varied mixture or medley of different things, especially incongruous elements
examples: The festival featured a melange of musical styles and cultures
Her outfit was an odd melange of vintage and modern pieces

definitions: dark pigment in skin, hair, and eyes that provides color and protection from ultraviolet radiation
examples: People with more melanin have better natural sun protection
Melanin production increases with exposure to sunlight

definitions: serious form of skin cancer that develops in melanin-producing cells
examples: Early detection of melanoma greatly improves treatment outcomes
The dermatologist removed a suspicious mole to test for melanoma

definitions: hormone produced by the brain that regulates sleep-wake cycles and circadian rhythms
examples: Taking melatonin supplements helped her adjust to the new time zone
The body naturally produces more melatonin when it gets dark

definitions: combination or blend of different elements merged together into a unified whole
examples: The dish was a perfect meld of Asian and European flavors
Their partnership created a unique meld of artistic talents

definitions: confused struggle or skirmish involving many people fighting at close quarters
examples: A melee broke out when rival fans clashed after the game
The battle descended into a chaotic melee of hand-to-hand combat

definitions: dramatic work characterized by exaggerated emotions, stereotypical characters, and interpersonal conflicts
examples: The soap opera was pure melodrama with its endless plot twists
Victorian melodramas always featured clear heroes and villains

definitions: sequence of musical notes that form the main tune of a song or composition
examples: The song's melody was so catchy everyone was humming it
She played a beautiful melody on her violin

definitions: large round fruit with sweet juicy flesh and hard rind, including watermelons and cantaloupes
examples: Fresh melon slices made a refreshing summer snack
The farmer's market offered several varieties of ripe melons

definitions: sudden disastrous collapse or failure, especially emotional or systemic breakdown
severe overheating of a nuclear reactor core causing release of radiation
examples: The company faced a financial meltdown after the scandal broke
She had a complete meltdown when she lost her job
The nuclear meltdown at Chernobyl had devastating environmental consequences
Emergency cooling systems prevent reactor meltdown during power failures

definitions: process of changing from solid to liquid state by heating or warming
examples: The melting of polar ice caps threatens coastal communities
Chocolate melting requires careful temperature control

definitions: water formed by the melting of snow and ice, especially from glaciers
examples: Spring meltwater swelled the mountain streams to dangerous levels
Glacial meltwater carved deep valleys through the landscape

definitions: thin, flexible sheet or layer of tissue or material that covers, lines, or separates parts
examples: Cell membranes control what enters and exits the cell
The drum's membrane vibrated to produce different sounds
